body.p: Select the desired optional services on the Optional Services tab.
body.note: Mitel Business Analytics is selected by default if it is deployed in your solution.

section.title: Hot Desk
section.p: For the hot desking feature, configure the hot desk enabled phones for the site. A hot desk user can log into any hot desk enabled phone and the system applies the user’s profile to the phone. If you have selected the Hot Desk feature, click the Hot Desk tab and complete the following:

strow.stentry: Enter the starting extension number (default 2000) of the range of numbers that the system will assign to the hot desk enabled phones. The hot desk extensions must be different from the extension numbers that you entered in the Numbering Plan screen (that is, the numbers must not overlap).
Enter the number of phones that you want to support hot desking.

This field displays the range of extension numbers that the wizard assigns to the hot desk devices.The extension numbers are assigned consecutively.
Ensure that the selected extension range does not conflict with the system’s dialing plan.

section.title: Web and Video Conferencing (AWV)
section.p: If you have selected the Web and Video Conferencing (AWV) feature, click the AWV tab and complete the following:

strow.stentry: The Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the AWV server.
Main number that users dial to join a MiCollab AWV conference. The maximum number of characters allowed is 26. Valid characters are 0 through 9, +, -, (), ., x, and X.
Toll-free number that users dial to join a MiCollab AWV conference. The maximum number of characters allowed is 26. Valid characters are 0 through 9, +, -, (), ., x, and X.

Direct Inward Dialing (DID) being provision in MiVoice Business. This number is typically the same number as the main number that users dial to join the conference. The maximum number of characters allowed is 26. Valid characters are 0 through 9, *, and #.

section.title: Music On Hold (MoH)
section.p:
Music On Hold (MoH) provides callers with music or information while they are waiting for a call to complete. If you have selected the Music On Hold (MoH) feature, click the MoH tab and do the following:
Click Browse and navigate to the folder where you have stored the audio file.
The audio file must be of the following format:
Audio type: Microsoft Windows WAV (.wav)
Audio format: CCITT u-Law or A-Law 8.000 kHz, 8 Bit, Mono
Select the file and click Open.

section.title: Mitel Business Analytics
section.p: Mitel Business Analytics is selected by default if it is deployed in your solution. For the Mitel Business Analytics feature, MiVB configures with the following SMDR (Station Message Detail Recording) parameters for Mitel Business Analytics:

strow.stentry: Indicates that the Called, Calling and Third Party fields allow space for 7-digit extension numbers, and the Duration of Call field allow space for up to 10,000 hours (9999 hours, 59 minutes, 59 seconds).
Indicates that all transfers including attendant transfers are to be reported.
Indicates that the recording of the originating line's identity in the Digits Dialed field is allowed.
Indicates that account codes are part of the SMDR reports.
Indicates that incoming calls are part of the SMDR reports.
Indicates that internal SMDR is purchased.
Indicates that outgoing calls are part of the SMDR reports.
Indicates that an SMDR record is generated after each outgoing call transfer, stating the duration and number of meter pulses for that user's portion of the call.

Indicates that a time stamp appears when a TIME or DATE command is entered. Two records will appear on the SMDR report. The first will indicate the time prior to the TIME or DATE command; the second will indicate the time entered by the SET TIME command.
Indicates that all time entries in the SMDR reports are in 24-hour notation.
Indicates that ANI/DNIS or CLASS digits are part of the SMDR reports.
Indicates that expanded Time To Answer field support is enabled.
Indicates that standardized SMDR functionality is enabled.
Indicates that standardized call ID format functionality is enabled.

Indicates that SMDR records in Extended Reporting Level 1 format are produced. This format accommodates International ANI digit strings and Attendant Line Appearances resulting in longer SMDR records.

Indicates that SMDR records in Extended Reporting Level 2 format are produced. This format accommodates International ANI digit strings and Attendant Line Appearances resulting in longer SMDR records.
